description: This shows the candidate is currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Information Systems. This aligns with the job's requirement of a BS or MS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or an equivalent degree, even though it is not yet completed.

text: Courses work: Data Structures and Algorithms,
description: Listing relevant coursework like Data Structures and Algorithms, Object-Oriented Programming, and Database Management Systems demonstrates a foundational understanding of computer science principles, which is vital for a software engineer. These courses are directly applicable to software development tasks.

text: Tech stacks : Spring boot, Nextjs, JWT, Material UI,
description: Listing these technologies demonstrates skills in modern web development, which is beneficial. The CV shows that the candidate is using these technologies in their projects, which provide more depth.

Listing these programming languages demonstrates a broad skill set. While the job description mentions C#, .NET, SQL, and mobile development, proficiency in Java, JavaScript, and TypeScript indicates the candidate is adaptable and can learn new languages and frameworks.

This section is very general. The role would require a candidate with strong people skills and the CV does not clearly mention these skills. While participation in WebDev Studio and ACM/ICPC are good, they lack quantifiable achievements or specific roles that highlight communication, teamwork, or leadership skills. To improve, the candidate should provide more specific details about their contributions and accomplishments in these activities. For instance, describe the specific tasks they performed, any challenges they overcame, and the impact of their contributions.

While the project description shows use of modern technologies and demonstrates problem-solving skills, it lacks details relevant to the job description. The job description emphasizes experience in public safety or public health software. To improve, the candidate should highlight any aspects of the project that relate to data analysis, security, or reporting. Even if indirectly related, framing the project in a way that highlights transferable skills applicable to the target industry would be beneficial. Also, quantifying achievements with metrics would make the project more impressive.

While the skills section lists some relevant technologies, it doesn't mention .NET, C#, SQL Server, or SSRS, which are explicitly mentioned in the job description. This makes it harder to assess the candidate's direct suitability for the role. To improve, the candidate should include these technologies in the skills section if they have any experience with them, even if it's basic. If they don't have experience with these technologies, they should focus on highlighting transferable skills and express their willingness to learn them quickly.

While these awards demonstrate problem-solving and programming abilities, they are not directly related to the specific technologies or domain mentioned in the job description (C#, .NET, SQL, public safety/health). The candidate should consider adding any certificates or awards related to the technologies mentioned in the job description.
